bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from Virginia Douglas Strachan to Helen [s.n.], [n.d.]

div1.p: Strachan describes what she believes to be one of the last letters written by Henry Rose Carter as very beautiful.

div1.head: Letter from Virginia Douglas Strachan to Helen [s.n.], [n.d.]
div1.opener:
She always called
mother “Helen Gould.”.
MRS. VIRGINIA DOUGLAS STRACHAN
256 W. FREEMASON STREET
NORFOLK, VIRGINIA
My dear Helen:-
div1.p:
You are an
old puss cat I write
you long letters and
you never notice me,
what is wrong with you?
Thank you and Wayne
for information about
Dr. Carter. Dr Boleer
is his warmest friend
and admirer, and
not long ago he brought a
letter over and read
it to us. I think the
very last one he ever
had from Dr. Carter, and
it was Beautiful. The
last report is that Laura
will not be here. If
She shows up, I will call
and tell her about you.
MRS. VIRGINIA DOUGLAS STRACHAN
256 W. FREEMASON STREET
NORFOLK, VIRGINIA
Dr Boleer is giving
a dinner tomorrow
night, to Dr. Obair
who is to make an
address about Dr Carter
and the Judge her brother and our “Cousin Tom Wilcox” is
invited. You folks
have been teribly
gay this fall, and
the old lady tries
to keep up with the [unclear]
Virginia Charlie's wife
and I gave a tea last
week which was I think
the biggest thing that has
been pulled off. We sent
out four hundred invitations.
The house was lovely.
We decorated with yellow
red and lavender chrysanthemums
and my house is done.
